remarks.format: ## Remarks 回历识别一个纪元： A.H。The Hijri calendar recognizes one era: A.H. (拉丁语 "基督 Hegirae"，这意味着 "迁移的年份"，其中 (从 Mecca) 迁移 Muhammad PBUH) 。(Latin "Anno Hegirae", which means "the year of the migration," in reference to the migration of Muhammad (PBUH) from Mecca). > [!NOTE] > 有关使用 .NET Framework 中的类和其他 calendar 类的信息，请参阅使用 [日历](/dotnet/standard/datetime/working-with-calendars)。For information about using the class and the other calendar classes in the .NET Framework, see [Working with Calendars](/dotnet/standard/datetime/working-with-calendars). 在每30年期内，每30年结束一年时，该年份均可被30整除，第二、第五、第7、第13、13、16、18、21、24日、26和29年是闰年。In every 30-year cycle that ends with a year that is evenly divisible by 30, the 2nd, 5th, 7th, 10th, 13th, 16th, 18th, 21st, 24th, 26th, and 29th years are leap years. 一个常见年份有354天，闰年有355天。A common year has 354 days and a leap year has 355 days. days in Ramadan vary. 日期公元2001年1月1日The date January 1, 2001 A.D. 在公历中，公历大致相当于1421年 Shawwal 的第六天，即 A.H。in the Gregorian calendar is roughly equivalent to the sixth day of Shawwal in the year 1421 A.H. 在 Hijri 日历中。in the Hijri calendar. 此 类实现通过添加或减去从零到两天的值来调整日历日期，以适应斋月开始时间和结束时间之间的差异，并满足国家/地区之间的日期差。This implementation of the class adjusts the calendar date by adding or subtracting a value from zero to two days to accommodate the variances in the start and the end of Ramadan and to accommodate the date difference between countries/regions. 该值存储在 属性中。That value is stored in the property. 如果 未显式设置，它将从 "控制面板" 的 "区域和语言选项" 部分的设置中派生其值，并将其存储在注册表值 HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Control Panel\International\AddHijriDate 中。If is not set explicitly, it derives its value from the settings in the regional and language options portion of Control Panel and is stored in the registry value HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Control Panel\International\AddHijriDate. 但是，该信息在的生命周期内可能会更改 。However, that information can change remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以用两位数年份表示的100年范围内的最后一年。 is the last year in the 100-year range that can be represented by a two-digit year. 通过在 `year` 该100年范围内查找两位数的唯一匹配项来确定纪元。The century is determined by finding the sole occurrence of the two-digit `year` within that 100-year range. 例如，如果 设置为1429，则100年的范围是从1330到 1429; 因此，两位数字的30值被解释为1330，而两位数字的值29则解释为1429。For example, if is set to 1429, the 100-year range is from 1330 to 1429; therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 1330, while a 2-digit value of 29 is interpreted as 1429. 支持两位数年份或四位数年份。 supports either a two-digit year or a four-digit year. 如果将两位数的年份值 (小于 100) ，则会使方法根据表示相应世纪的值将值转换为四位值 。Passing a two-digit year value (less than 100) causes the method to convert the value to a four-digit value according to the value representing the appropriate century. 如果应用程序提供了在支持的日历范围内的四位数年份值 ，则该方法将返回实际输入值。If the application supplies a four-digit year value that is within the supported calendar range to , the method returns the actual input value. 如果应用程序提供了一个在支持的日历范围之外的四位数值，或者如果它提供负值，则该方法将引发异常。If the application supplies a four-digit value that is outside the supported calendar range, or if it supplies a negative value, the method throws an exception.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性允许将两位数的年份正确翻译为四位数年份。This property allows a 2-digit year to be properly translated to a 4-digit year. 例如，如果将此属性设置为1429，则100年范围是从1330到1429。For example, if this property is set to 1429, the 100-year range is from 1330 to 1429. 因此，两位数值30被解释为1330，而两位数字的值29则解释为1429。Therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 1330, while a 2-digit value of 29 is interpreted as 1429. 此属性的初始值派生自控制面板的 "区域和语言选项" 部分中的设置。The initial value of this property is derived from the settings in the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 但是，该信息在的生命周期内可能会更改 。However, that information can change during the life of the . 类不会自动检测系统设置中的更改。The class does not detect changes in the system settings automatically. 应用程序应将此值设置为99，以指示要按字面取的两位数年份。The application should set this value to 99 to indicate that 2-digit years are to be taken literally. 例如，如果将此属性设置为99，则100年的范围为 0 (不是大多数日历) 到99的有效值。For example, if this property is set to 99, the 100-year range is from 0 (not a valid value for most calendars) to 99. 因此，两位数值30被解释为30。Therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 30.
